means: 保持（头发或皮肤等的）健康

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"状况，情况"之意。
means: condition ： 一般强调产生影响的原因或环境，复数形式指笼统的情况。
state ： 普通用词，指人或物在环境、外表、心灵以及健康方面的状况，或指在某一阶段的状态或形式。
status ： 指一个人在政治、社会、经济、法律上的地位或身份，暗含地位显要意味。也可用于指政治等事态的状况。
situation ： 指明确具体的环境情况或处境。
circumstance ： 多指周围的情况或某事发生时的情况。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"条件"之意。
means: condition ： 通常指为实现许诺、协议、计划、合同等而订出的必须遵守或满足的作为前提的条件或要求。
terms ： 指谈判或订立合同等时，一方或双方提出或同意的条件。

sentence.Network_en: He was concerned with the enhancement of the human condition.
sentence.Network_cn: 他关心人类生存环境的改善。

sentence.Network_en: Rust and flaking paint mean the metalwork is in poor condition.
sentence.Network_cn: 生锈和掉漆说明金属配件损毁严重。

sentence.Network_en: You'll also get expert advice on keeping your hair in good condition.
sentence.Network_cn: 你还会获得有关如何保持良好发质的专家建议。

jx.jx_en_mean: in a fit (or unfit) physical state

phrase.cizu_name: in no condition to do something

jx.jx_en_mean: certainly not fit or well enough to do something
jx.jx_cn_mean: （健康状况，身体状况）不适宜做某事

lj.lj_ly: you’re in no condition to tackle the stairs.
lj.lj_ls: 你的身体不适宜爬楼梯。

lj.lj_ly: I got three years' probation, on condition that I stay at the hostel for a year.
lj.lj_ls: 我得到三年试用期，条件是我必须在招待所呆满一年。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French condicion (noun), condicionner (verb), from Latin condicio(n-) 'agreement', from condicere 'agree upon', from con- 'with' + dicere 'say'

entry.def: If you talk about the condition of a person or thing, you are talking about the state that they are in, especially how good or bad their physical state is.

example.ex: He remains in a critical condition in a California hospital...
example.tran: 他在加州的一家医院里，病情仍然十分危急。

example.ex: I received several compliments on the condition of my skin...
example.tran: 好几个人夸我的皮肤保养得好。

entry.tran: (某事完成或发生的)环境，条件
entry.def: The conditions under which something is done or happens are all the factors or circumstances which directly affect it.

example.ex: This change has been timed under laboratory conditions...
example.tran: 在实验室条件下测得了这一变化所需的时间。

example.ex: The mild winter has created the ideal conditions for an ant population explosion.
example.tran: 暖冬为蚁群数量激增创造了理想的条件。

entry.def: The conditions in which people live or work are the factors which affect their comfort, safety, or health.

example.ex: People are living in appalling conditions...
example.tran: 人们的居住条件极其恶劣。

example.ex: He could not work in these conditions any longer...
example.tran: 他再也不能在这样的条件下工作了。

entry.tran: (某一群人的)生活状况，境况;(尤指)艰难处境
entry.def: The condition of a group of people is their situation in life, especially with regard to the difficulties they have.

example.ex: The condition of the people could be elevated by a programme of social reform...
example.tran: 人们的生活状况可以通过社会改革方案得到改善。

example.ex: The government has encouraged its people to better their condition.
example.tran: 政府鼓励人民改善生活状况。

entry.tran: (尤指写入合同或法律的)条件，条款
entry.def: A condition is something which must happen or be done in order for something else to be possible, especially when this is written into a contract or law.

example.ex: ...economic targets set as a condition for loan payments.
example.tran: 作为贷款偿还条件所设定的经济目标

entry.def: If someone has a particular condition, they have an illness or other medical problem.

example.ex: Doctors suspect he may have a heart condition.
example.tran: 医生怀疑他可能有心脏病。

example.ex: ...a rare condition that causes degeneration of the brain tissue.
example.tran: 引起脑组织变性的罕见疾病

entry.def: If someone is conditioned by their experiences or environment, they are influenced by them over a period of time so that they do certain things or think in a particular way.

example.ex: We are all conditioned by early impressions and experiences...
example.tran: 我们都受到早年印象和经历的影响。

example.ex: You have been conditioned to believe that it is weak to be scared...
example.tran: 你习惯性地认为害怕是软弱的表现。

entry.def: To condition your hair or skin means to put something on it which will keep it in good condition.

example.ex: ...a protein which is excellent for conditioning dry and damaged hair.
example.tran: 对干燥、受损的头发有极佳护理效果的蛋白质

entry.tran: (因病重、烦乱或酒醉而)不能(做某事)
entry.def: If you say that someone is in no condition to do something, you mean that they are too ill, upset, or drunk to do it.

example.ex: She was clearly in no condition to see anyone.

entry.def: When you agree to do something on condition that something else happens, you mean that you will only do it if this other thing also happens.

example.ex: He spoke to reporters on condition that he was not identified.
example.tran: 在不披露身份的条件下，他接受了记者的采访。

entry.tran: (由于缺乏锻炼而)身体状况不佳
entry.def: If someone is out of condition, they are unhealthy and unfit, because they do not do enough exercise.

example.ex: He was too out of condition to clamber over the top.
example.tran: 他体质太差，爬不到山顶。

means.word_mean: 1. a state at a particular time;

sentences.sentence: "the current status of the arms negotiations"

means.word_mean: 2. a mode of being or form of existence of a person or thing;
3. an assumption on which rests the validity or effect of something else
4. (usually plural) a statement of what is required as part of an agreement;

sentences.sentence: "the contract set out the conditions of the lease"
"the terms of the treaty were generous"

means.word_mean: 5. the state of (good) health (especially in the phrases `in condition' or `in shape' or `out of condition' or `out of shape')
6. information that should be kept in mind when making a decision;

sentences.sentence: "another consideration is the time it would take"

means.word_mean: 7. the procedure that is varied in order to estimate a variable's effect by comparison with a control condition
2. train by instruction and practice; especially to teach self-control;
3. specify as a condition or requirement in a contract or agreement; make an express demand or provision in an agreement;

sentences.sentence: "The will stipulates that she can live in the house for the rest of her life"
"The contract stipulates the dates of the payments"

means.word_mean: 5. apply conditioner to in order to make smooth and shiny;

sentences.sentence: "I condition my hair after washing it"

auth_sentence.content: Looking at the condition, it normally requires surgery.

con共同+dit给予+ion表名词→共同给出的条件

Sentence.sentence: Global warming is a trend toward warmer conditions around the world.
Scientists are in general agreement that the warmer conditions we have been experiencing are at least in part the result of a human-induced global warming trend

Some scientistsmaintain that the changes we are seeing fall within the range of random (无规律的) variation—some years are cold, others warm, and we have just had an unremarkable string of warm yearsrecently—but that is becoming an increasingly rare interpretation in the face of continued and increasing warm conditions.
We learn from the first paragraph that the sound of a forest signifies its health condition.
the sound of a forest signifies its health condition
the condition of rain forests has been rapidly deteriorating

sentences.cn: 才干和努力是成功的条件。

means.word_mean: 作为…的条件；规定；决定；约束

sentences.en: My expenditure is conditioned by my income.
sentences.cn: 我的支出取决于我的收入。

means.word_mean: 置于适当情况，使处于正常状态

sentences.en: You need to condition yourself if you are to play in the football match on Saturday.
sentences.cn: 如果你要参加星期六的足球比赛，就需要把你自己调整到最佳状态。

jushi.english: Health is one of the conditions of success in life.
jushi.chinese: 健康是成功的条件之一。

jushi.english: These laws are not calculated for conditions at any time.
jushi.chinese: 这几种法令任何时候都不会适合当时的情况。

jushi.english: The government hopes to better the conditions of the peasants.
jushi.chinese: 政府希望改善农民的生活条件。
